title: Digital tools for improving the efficiency of public procurement of works in the Republic of Kazakhstan
research_description: This study explores the efficiency of public procurement of works in Kazakhstan, analyzing issues related to price and quality balance, transparency, and competition. The authors propose a model for improving procurement efficiency through the integration of digital tools.
research_results: The study identifies key problems such as limited competition, insufficient quality control of goods, and the absence of digital monitoring tools. The proposed model emphasizes the use of digital platforms to enhance transparency, reduce bureaucracy, and improve quality control in public procurement.
future_research: Further research should focus on the implementation of digital tools in other sectors of public procurement and assess their long-term impact on procurement efficiency.
